GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1348 by King Charles IV. Became a State institution 1773 when the Society of Jesus was dissolved. Divided in 1882 into separate Czech and German universities each bearing the title Charles-Ferdinand. Present title adopted 1918. Closed in November 1939 during the German occupation; reopened 1945 at which time the German university was abolished. Acquired present status 1999. Was previously know as Charles University in Prague (Univerzita Karlova v Praze).
GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: October to September (July – August = summer vacations). Winter Semester = October – mid-February. Summer Semester = Mid-February – September (July – August = summer vacations). For more information see: http://www.cuni.cz/UKEN-26.html.
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (Maturitní vysvědčeni); Entrance examination

Divisions.College: Center for Economic Research and Graduate Education

Divisions.Details: CTS performstheoretical research in diverse fields, ranging from the humanities through various social science disciplines to the exact sciences. CTS stimulates transdisciplinary approaches to science.

GeneralInformation.History: Founded in 1919 with Faculties of Law, Medecine, Science and Arts; Faculty of Education established in 1947, Economics and Administration in 1990, Informatics in 1994, Social Studies in 1998 and Sports Studies in 2002. The Faculty of Pharmacy was part of Masaryk University from 1952 to 1960 and has been part of it again since 2020. Closed 1939-1945 during the German occupation. Became Jan Evangelista Purkyně University in 1960; Renamed Masaryk University again since 1989

GeneralInformation.History: We are a private university founded in 2000 by Škoda Auto a.s., the largest car manufacturer in the Czech Republic. We offer students unique bachelor's and master's degree programmes and specialisations combining economic and technical education. The Bachelor's degree is 3.5 years long and includes a financially rewarded compulsory internship in the 5th semester, which students do at top employers not only in the Czech Republic but also abroad. Students of the follow-up Master's programme can choose a six-week internship as part of the compulsory elective courses. Teaching takes place in Czech or English, in full-time or combined form in Mladá Boleslav or Prague and is based on an individual approach.
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (Maturitní vysvědčeni); Entrance examination

Address.university_name: Vysoká škola finanční a správní, a.s. (VŠFS)

GeneralInformation.History:
Founded by the Bank Academy and Czech Coal Group in 1999. In 2001 its study centers in Most and Kladno were opened. A year later MBA study programs were launched in cooperation with City University Seattle (USA). Another year later the school set up Eupress, a publishing house producing study materials and books. In March 2003, VSFS acquired accreditation for the follow-up Master study. In the course of its first 5 years of existence the school became the biggest private institution of higher education in the CR in terms of the number of both students and teachers.
In 2009, the University of Finance and Administration has received state approval for Doctoral study program and became the first private University of Economics in the Czech Republic.
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (Maturitní vysvědčeni); Entrance examination; Certificate of proficiency in language of chosen program

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1991, incorporating the Faculty of Agronomy (detached part of Prague Agricultural University) with independent Faculty of Education, and recruiting additional staff from several research institutes of the Czech Academy of Sciences located in the area (Botany, Entomology, Hydrobiology, Landscape Ecology, Microbiology, Molecular Biology of Plants, Parasitology, Soil Science), and from local hospitals and religious institutions. Close extramural collaboration and a high proportion of part-time teachers remain a typical feature of the University. Financed by the State.
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate (Maturitní vysvědčeni) with leaving examination, and entrance examinations
